title: Introducing – The Rifts
content:
Bandcamp is a cruel mistress, as she teases you with rare occasions of an undiscovered talent, though more often than not she simply serves you up a plentiful portion of despair in what many people consider worth sharing with the world.

However last night I found myself on the kinder and more fortunate side of her volatile personality, and I was rewarded with the ambient hip-hop stylings of The Rifts.

A quartet based in San Bernardino, California, The Rifts debut release Cherry Blossoms proves a very intriguing first listen. Beginning with a track paradoxically entitled ‘Departure’, the vocals are reminiscent of the gravely stylings of Eels, before then bursting into verses of intimate and smooth rap. Cementing this altogether is a finely orchestrated soundtrack of guitar riffs and etheral synths that establish the beautiful hybrid nature of The Rifts sound. It is this fusion of genres and styles that elevates Cherry Blossoms above the efforts of many similar artists, and most excitingly it promises a considerable level of potential for an even more developed and crafted full length release.
